article:
Once, looking for stories on the back roads of Ohio, we weren't getting on smoothly. A beekeeper we'd been told about was away from home   _  we called on him. An
amusement park where we thought we might find a  _  had shut down for the season. We began to get a little  _  .
When   _  a farmhouse,
we found a banner between two trees in the front yard. The banner  _  in huge letters: WELCOME HOME,ROGER! We drove   _  for a mile or two. Somebody
said, "Wonder who Roger is?" We  turned around     ,went back there
and knocked on the door.
Roger was a soldier on his way home from war. His   _  knew he was coming, but weren't sure what day he was going to  _  . We asked if they'd mind if we brought the camera into the house. Roger's
mother said it would be all right if we could give her a few minutes
to  fix her hair     .We weren't there more than an
hour, talking to those people who were all  _  about
Roger coming home and taking pictures.
In the bus as we   _  on
that afternoon, I wrote a simple story letting Roger  _  all the soldiers coming home from war. We sent the  _  with the story to New York, and Walter Cronkite put it on the Evening
news.  _  has any of our stories
caused such a reaction from viewers. The CBS switchboard   _  up that night with dozens of calls from people   _  by it in some way, and hundreds of letters came in, some of them suggesting
that the story be  _     .There was so much  _  throughout that that Cronkite had to report a few nights  _     ,"Oh, and by the way--Roger got home!"
